newsitem.title: UK: Specialeyes details offer from Optical.
newsitem.headline: Specialeyes details offer from Optical.

text.p: British retail optician Specialeyes Plc said on Tuesday that Optical Express (Southern) Ltd has made a recommended cash offer valuing the company at 1.92 million stg.
Optical Express, an independently owned chain of opticians in Scotland, has made an offer of six pence for each ordinary share in Specialeyes.
Specialeyes' directors have agreed to accept the offer. Their shareholdings amoun to 6.34 million Specialeyes ordinary shares which represent 19.8 percent of the company.
"Against a background of increasingly competitive market place, there has been no improvement in trading performance in the second half of the year," Tim Franey, Chairman of Specialeyes said.
"This has resulted in a deteriorating financial position which prevents the company from completing the plans outlined in the interim statement," he added.
If the offer fails the company said it would need to undertake a major restructuring of the company which would be likely to impact adversely upon shareholder value, it said.
Specialeyes has 63 outlets nationwide while Optical Express currently operates through 20 outlets.
By 0920 GMT, shares in Specialeyes were down 4p at 6-1/2p.
